title: Giorgio Chiellini set to return from anterior cruciate ligament injury in time for Euro 2020
text:
Giorgio Chiellini could make a return to Juventus' first team before the end of the season after suffering an anterior cruciate ligament injury, according to his agent.

The 35-year-old suffered the injury in training at the end of August, but is on track to be fit to play for his country at Euro 2020.

Chiellini is fourth on Juventus' all-time appearance list with 507 games over 14 years in Turn.

Giorgio Chiellini could be back in action for Juventus before the end of the current season

'His recovery is progressing positively and the man has this magnetic positivity,' Davide Lippi told TMW Radio.

'It's incredible. He works so hard every day and when I call him up, he's the one who reassures me. He is making giant leaps forward.

'I don't know the precise date of his comeback, but it will certainly be in the New Year.

'It might be the end of January, February or March, but he will certainly be there for the final part of the season.'
